_meta.instructions: Each industry contains an array of archetypes. To add a new industry, copy the structure of an existing one. To add a new archetype, copy an existing archetype object and update all fields. Radar values are 0‚Äì100. CX principle scores are 1‚Äì10.

fields_guide.name: Evocative archetype name, e.g. 'Truth Seekers'
fields_guide.latin: Latin motto with English meaning in parentheses
fields_guide.description: 2-3 sentences. Who they are behaviorally. Implied first person: I am‚Ä¶
fields_guide.goals: 2-3 sentences. What success looks like. I want‚Ä¶
fields_guide.needs: 2-3 sentences. What they actually do. I do‚Ä¶
fields_guide.touchpoints: 2-3 sentences. Which channels and why. I use‚Ä¶
fields_guide.cx_principles.higher_order: Recognition, Integrity, Expectations, Empathy, Emotions ‚Äî scored 1‚Äì10
fields_guide.cx_principles.basic_order: Resolution, Speed, Effort, Enablement, Convenience ‚Äî scored 1‚Äì10
fields_guide.goals_radar: 9 axes: Recognition, New Image, Future Growth, New Lifestyle, Family Place, Service & Support, Risks & Reassurance, Enablement & Tools, Guidance & Advice
fields_guide.needs_radar: 8 axes: Information, Content & Inspiration, Offers & Price, Payment Options, Guidance & Advice, Enablement & Tools, Risks & Reassurance, Service & Support
fields_guide.touchpoints_radar: 8 axes: Online Search, Showrooms, Brand Website, Partner/Broker, Social Media, Aggregators, Community, Word of Mouth
fields_guide.expectations: Array of strings ‚Äî what they expect from the experience
fields_guide.barriers: Array of strings ‚Äî what holds them back
fields_guide.drivers: Array of strings ‚Äî what motivates them
fields_guide.triggers: Array of strings ‚Äî what sets them into motion
fields_guide.important_steps: Array of strings ‚Äî key stages in their journey
fields_guide.solution_principles: Array of strings ‚Äî HTML allowed for emphasis. Format: 'Because they need X, the experience must be Y.'

real_estate.label: Real Estate & Property
real_estate.description: Buyers, renters and investors navigating one of life's highest-stakes decisions.

archetypes.name: Home, Sweet Home
archetypes.description: I lead a busy life and one of my key priorities is to take care of my family and its many needs. A property purchase is going to provide security, protection and comfort my family deserves. It's a one-shot decision and I need to be reassured that it will secure my family's future financially and protect its privacy.
archetypes.goals: My goal is to find a home for every family member that will not just be a place to live, but a reward and recognition for us as a family ‚Äî with a personal touch for every member. Something that will highlight our individualities and bring us together.
archetypes.needs: To reach that goal, I am doing a lot of research, exploration and deal-hunting, for which I need guidance and content. I want to learn more about smart ways of maintaining a better work-life balance and I need personalisation options as important as the community I will be buying in.
archetypes.touchpoints: Friends, agents that I trust, social media and online search are important channels. But even more so it's the opportunity to touch and feel what my future home will look like. I don't want to be rushed, good choice takes time, I want to be perceived as the one who makes the decision ‚Äî not the developer or agent.
solution_principles: Because they need guidance and content to make every family member happy, the experience must be guided, but full of opportunities for personalisation.
Because they need a secure way to finalize the transaction to avoid putting financials at risk, the experience has to be reassuring and risk-free.
Because they need inspiration on how to organize their future home to fulfill the family dreams, the experience has to be adventurous, creating opportunities to discover and try new things.

archetypes.name: The Wealth Guardian
archetypes.description: I see property not as a home but as a vehicle for wealth preservation and generational transfer. Every decision is filtered through return on investment, capital appreciation and risk mitigation. I am analytical, patient and rarely impressed by aesthetics alone ‚Äî numbers must speak first.
archetypes.goals: I want to build a portfolio that outlasts market volatility, delivers reliable yield and appreciates over a ten-year horizon. Recognition matters to me as a sophisticated investor, not as a homeowner.
archetypes.needs: I research macroeconomic indicators, track developer track records and compare yield data obsessively. I need transparent financial modelling, off-plan data and direct access to senior advisors who understand investment logic.
archetypes.touchpoints: I rely on financial publications, industry reports, private banking relationships and referrals from trusted investment networks. Showrooms are largely irrelevant ‚Äî data rooms and one-on-one briefings are where I make decisions.
solution_principles: Because they need data transparency before trust, the experience must lead with facts, not feelings ‚Äî numbers before narratives.
Because they fear reputational and financial risk, the brand must position itself as a credible, track-record-backed partner rather than a sales operation.
Because they value time as much as capital, the journey must eliminate friction and provide senior-level access at every critical decision point.

archetypes.name: The Status Architect
archetypes.latin: Ostendo Ergo Sum (I Show Therefore I Am)
archetypes.description: I purchase property as a statement ‚Äî of arrival, of taste, of a life well-built. The brand behind the development matters as much as the unit itself. I want what others aspire to, and I want to feel that exclusivity in every interaction from first enquiry to handover.
archetypes.goals: I want a property that elevates my social currency, is photographable, and is located in an address that commands instant recognition. I want the purchase process itself to feel premium ‚Äî discreet, attentive, and tailored to me personally.
archetypes.needs: I engage with luxury lifestyle media, follow design-forward developers on social channels, and expect white-glove treatment at every touchpoint. I am drawn to limited availability, signature architecture and curated lifestyle amenities.
archetypes.touchpoints: Instagram, architecture publications, luxury lifestyle events and private previews are my primary channels. Word of mouth from peers I respect carries enormous weight. I expect a dedicated relationship manager ‚Äî not a generic sales agent.
solution_principles: Because they buy with emotion and justify with logic, the experience must engage their sense of self before presenting the product.
Because they fear being treated as just another buyer, every touchpoint must be personalised, named, and curated to feel exclusive.
Because they are influenced by peers and aesthetics, the brand must create shareable, visual, prestige-signalling moments throughout the journey.

archetypes.name: The Brave First-Timer
archetypes.latin: Primum Gressum Facio (I Take the First Step)
archetypes.description: I am entering the property market for the first time, navigating a world of jargon, paperwork and financial commitment that feels overwhelming. I want to get it right but I am scared of getting it wrong. I need someone to trust, not someone to sell to me.
archetypes.goals: I want to own my first home ‚Äî a place that is truly mine, that gives me stability and a sense of achievement. I want to feel proud, not fooled. The experience of buying should feel as good as the moment I get the keys.
archetypes.needs: I research extensively online before speaking to anyone. I read forums, watch YouTube walkthroughs and compare mortgage calculators. I need step-by-step guidance, plain-language explanations and reassurance that I am not missing something critical.
archetypes.touchpoints: Google, YouTube, property aggregator apps and Reddit-style community forums are where I spend most of my research time. When I am ready to engage, I need a human ‚Äî but one who educates rather than pressures. WhatsApp and live chat feel less threatening than formal sales offices.
solution_principles: Because they are overwhelmed by complexity, the experience must simplify every step into plain, human language with no assumed knowledge.
Because they fear being misled, integrity must be built into every communication ‚Äî transparent fees, honest timelines, no hidden conditions.
Because the emotional peak is the moment of ownership, the journey must build towards that milestone with rituals, celebration and genuine care.

banking.label: Banking & Financial Services
banking.description: Retail, private and business banking customers navigating trust, complexity and financial wellbeing.

archetypes.name: The Cautious Planner
archetypes.description: Placeholder ‚Äî populate with real insights for Banking & Financial Services.
archetypes.goals: Populate with goals for this archetype in a banking context.
archetypes.needs: Populate with behavioral needs for this archetype.
archetypes.touchpoints: Populate with key channels and touchpoint preferences.
solution_principles: Because they need certainty, every interaction must reduce ambiguity and reinforce trust through transparency.
Because they fear financial loss, the experience must proactively reassure at every high-stakes moment.
Because they plan long-term, the brand must become a genuine financial partner, not just a product provider.

hospitality.label: Hospitality & Tourism
hospitality.description: Travellers and guests seeking escape, experience and emotional connection.

archetypes.name: The Experience Curator
archetypes.latin: Vita Brevis Ars Longa (Life is Short, Art is Long)
archetypes.description: Placeholder ‚Äî populate with real insights for Hospitality & Tourism.
archetypes.goals: Populate with goals for this archetype in a hospitality context.
archetypes.needs: Populate with behavioral needs for this archetype.
archetypes.touchpoints: Populate with key channels and touchpoint preferences.
solution_principles: Because they buy emotion, not rooms, every touchpoint must be designed to create a feeling, not just complete a function.
Because they share experiences, the brand must create moments worth remembering and worth posting.
Because they fear wasted time and money, the promise must always match or exceed the reality.

healthcare.label: Healthcare & Wellness
healthcare.description: Patients, caregivers and wellness seekers navigating vulnerability, complexity and trust.

archetypes.name: The Vigilant Advocate
archetypes.description: Placeholder ‚Äî populate with real insights for Healthcare & Wellness.
archetypes.goals: Populate with goals for this archetype in a healthcare context.
archetypes.needs: Populate with behavioral needs for this archetype.
archetypes.touchpoints: Populate with key channels and touchpoint preferences.
solution_principles: Because vulnerability is at its peak, the experience must be warm, human and reassuring at every clinical touchpoint.
Because information reduces anxiety, communication must be proactive, plain-language and never withheld.
Because trust is the currency, every interaction must earn it through consistency, expertise and genuine care.

retail_luxury.label: Luxury Retail & Fashion
retail_luxury.description: High-value consumers driven by identity, exclusivity and emotional reward.

archetypes.name: The Identity Collector
archetypes.latin: Habeo Ergo Sum (I Own Therefore I Am)
archetypes.description: Placeholder ‚Äî populate with real insights for Luxury Retail & Fashion.
archetypes.goals: Populate with goals for this archetype in a luxury retail context.
archetypes.needs: Populate with behavioral needs for this archetype.
archetypes.touchpoints: Populate with key channels and touchpoint preferences.
solution_principles: Because they purchase identity, not product, the experience must mirror and elevate their self-concept at every moment.
Because exclusivity is the product, the brand must make every customer feel like the only one.
Because the ritual matters as much as the item, the purchase experience must be as considered and crafted as what's inside the box.

automotive.label: Automotive
automotive.description: Buyers navigating a high-involvement, emotionally charged purchase with both rational and aspirational drivers.

archetypes.name: The Precision Driver
archetypes.description: Placeholder ‚Äî populate with real insights for the Automotive industry.
archetypes.goals: Populate with goals for this archetype in an automotive context.
archetypes.needs: Populate with behavioral needs for this archetype.
archetypes.touchpoints: Populate with key channels and touchpoint preferences.
barriers: Lack of transparency on total cost
solution_principles: Because the test drive is the moment of truth, the in-person experience must match the promise of every digital touchpoint that came before it.
Because they research before they arrive, the brand must reward knowledge with transparency, not obfuscation.
Because ownership is a relationship, not a transaction, the post-purchase experience must be as considered as the pre-purchase journey.
